intro: Dampiera dura, commonly known as the hardy dampiera, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Dampiera dura is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
